speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Three thousand ducats; well.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Ay, sir, for three months.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: For three months; well.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: For the which, as I told you, Antonio shall be bound.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Antonio shall become bound; well.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: May you stead me? will you pleasure me? shall I

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: know your answer?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Three thousand ducats for three months and Antonio bound.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Your answer to that.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Antonio is a good man.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Have you heard any imputation to the contrary?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Oh, no, no, no, no: my meaning in saying he is a

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: good man is to have you understand me that he is

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: sufficient. Yet his means are in supposition: he

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: hath an argosy bound to Tripolis, another to the

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Indies; I understand moreover, upon the Rialto, he

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: hath a third at Mexico, a fourth for England, and

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: other ventures he hath, squandered abroad. But ships

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: are but boards, sailors but men: there be land-rats

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: and water-rats, water-thieves and land-thieves, I

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: mean pirates, and then there is the peril of waters,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: winds and rocks. The man is, notwithstanding,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: sufficient. Three thousand ducats; I think I may

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: take his bond.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Be assured you may.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I will be assured I may; and, that I may be assured,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I will bethink me. May I speak with Antonio?

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: If it please you to dine with us.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Yes, to smell pork; to eat of the habitation which

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: your prophet the Nazarite conjured the devil into. I

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: will buy with you, sell with you, talk with you,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: walk with you, and so following, but I will not eat

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: with you, drink with you, nor pray with you. What

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: news on the Rialto? Who is he comes here?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Enter ANTONIO

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: This is Signior Antonio.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: [Aside]  How like a fawning publican he looks!

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I hate him for he is a Christian,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: But more for that in low simplicity

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: He lends out money gratis and brings down

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: The rate of usance here with us in Venice.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: If I can catch him once upon the hip,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I will feed fat the ancient grudge I bear him.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: He hates our sacred nation, and he rails,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Even there where merchants most do congregate,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: On me, my bargains and my well-won thrift,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Which he calls interest. Cursed be my tribe,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: If I forgive him!

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Shylock, do you hear?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I am debating of my present store,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: And, by the near guess of my memory,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I cannot instantly raise up the gross

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Of full three thousand ducats. What of that?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Tubal, a wealthy Hebrew of my tribe,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Will furnish me. But soft! how many months

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Do you desire?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: To ANTONIO

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Rest you fair, good signior;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Your worship was the last man in our mouths.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Shylock, although I neither lend nor borrow

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: By taking nor by giving of excess,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Yet, to supply the ripe wants of my friend,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I'll break a custom. Is he yet possess'd

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: How much ye would?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Ay, ay, three thousand ducats.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: And for three months.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I had forgot; three months; you told me so.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Well then, your bond; and let me see; but hear you;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Methought you said you neither lend nor borrow

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Upon advantage.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I do never use it.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: When Jacob grazed his uncle Laban's sheep--

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: This Jacob from our holy Abram was,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: As his wise mother wrought in his behalf,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: The third possessor; ay, he was the third--

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: And what of him? did he take interest?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: No, not take interest, not, as you would say,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Directly interest: mark what Jacob did.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: When Laban and himself were compromised

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: That all the eanlings which were streak'd and pied

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Should fall as Jacob's hire, the ewes, being rank,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: In the end of autumn turned to the rams,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: And, when the work of generation was

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Between these woolly breeders in the act,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: The skilful shepherd peel'd me certain wands,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: And, in the doing of the deed of kind,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: He stuck them up before the fulsome ewes,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Who then conceiving did in eaning time

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Fall parti-colour'd lambs, and those were Jacob's.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: This was a way to thrive, and he was blest:

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: And thrift is blessing, if men steal it not.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: This was a venture, sir, that Jacob served for;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: A thing not in his power to bring to pass,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: But sway'd and fashion'd by the hand of heaven.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Was this inserted to make interest good?

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Or is your gold and silver ewes and rams?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I cannot tell; I make it breed as fast:

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: But note me, signior.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Mark you this, Bassanio,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: The devil can cite Scripture for his purpose.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: An evil soul producing holy witness

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Is like a villain with a smiling cheek,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: A goodly apple rotten at the heart:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: O, what a goodly outside falsehood hath!

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Three thousand ducats; 'tis a good round sum.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Three months from twelve; then, let me see; the rate--

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Well, Shylock, shall we be beholding to you?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Signior Antonio, many a time and oft

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: In the Rialto you have rated me

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: About my moneys and my usances:

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Still have I borne it with a patient shrug,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: For sufferance is the badge of all our tribe.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: You call me misbeliever, cut-throat dog,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: And spit upon my Jewish gaberdine,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: And all for use of that which is mine own.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Well then, it now appears you need my help:

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Go to, then; you come to me, and you say

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: 'Shylock, we would have moneys:' you say so;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: You, that did void your rheum upon my beard

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: And foot me as you spurn a stranger cur

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Over your threshold: moneys is your suit

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: What should I say to you? Should I not say

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: 'Hath a dog money? is it possible

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: A cur can lend three thousand ducats?' Or

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Shall I bend low and in a bondman's key,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: With bated breath and whispering humbleness, Say this;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: 'Fair sir, you spit on me on Wednesday last;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: You spurn'd me such a day; another time

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: You call'd me dog; and for these courtesies

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I'll lend you thus much moneys'?

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I am as like to call thee so again,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: To spit on thee again, to spurn thee too.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: If thou wilt lend this money, lend it not

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: As to thy friends; for when did friendship take

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: A breed for barren metal of his friend?

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: But lend it rather to thine enemy,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Who, if he break, thou mayst with better face

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Exact the penalty.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Why, look you, how you storm!

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I would be friends with you and have your love,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Forget the shames that you have stain'd me with,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Supply your present wants and take no doit

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Of usance for my moneys, and you'll not hear me:

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: This is kind I offer.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: This were kindness.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: This kindness will I show.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Go with me to a notary, seal me there

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Your single bond; and, in a merry sport,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: If you repay me not on such a day,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: In such a place, such sum or sums as are

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Express'd in the condition, let the forfeit

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Be nominated for an equal pound

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Of your fair flesh, to be cut off and taken

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: In what part of your body pleaseth me.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Content, i' faith: I'll seal to such a bond

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: And say there is much kindness in the Jew.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: You shall not seal to such a bond for me:

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: I'll rather dwell in my necessity.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Why, fear not, man; I will not forfeit it:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Within these two months, that's a month before

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: This bond expires, I do expect return

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Of thrice three times the value of this bond.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: O father Abram, what these Christians are,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Whose own hard dealings teaches them suspect

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: The thoughts of others! Pray you, tell me this;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: If he should break his day, what should I gain

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: By the exaction of the forfeiture?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: A pound of man's flesh taken from a man

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Is not so estimable, profitable neither,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: As flesh of muttons, beefs, or goats. I say,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: To buy his favour, I extend this friendship:

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: If he will take it, so; if not, adieu;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: And, for my love, I pray you wrong me not.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Yes Shylock, I will seal unto this bond.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Then meet me forthwith at the notary's;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Give him direction for this merry bond,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: And I will go and purse the ducats straight,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: See to my house, left in the fearful guard

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Of an unthrifty knave, and presently

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I will be with you.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Hie thee, gentle Jew.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Exit Shylock

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: The Hebrew will turn Christian: he grows kind.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: I like not fair terms and a villain's mind.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Come on: in this there can be no dismay;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: My ships come home a month before the day.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Exeunt
